repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Follow up to this thread here:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36705#discussion_r2566746425

Problem:

Our LSP type system didnt have a concept of RegistrationMethods, this is where the method to dynamically register for a capability is sent to a different method endpoint then is used to call it. Eg `textDocument/semanticTokens` rather than the specific full/range/delta methods

Solution:

Extended generator to create `vim.lsp.protocol.Methods.Registration` with these registration methods. Also extend `_request_name_to_client_capability` to cover these methods. Adjust typing to suit

comment_data.body: Nit but seeing snake case and camel case mixed up annoys me.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -141,7 +141,7 @@ function M.enable(name, enable, filter)
         local Capability = all_capabilities[name]
 
         if enable then
-          if it_client:supports_method(Capability.method) then
+          if it_client:supports_registrationMethod(Capability.method) then

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  for method, capability in pairs(lsp.protocol._request_name_to_server_capability) do
```
Since the import is aliased above.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -609,41 +609,22 @@ function Client:initialize()
   end)
 end
 
--- Server capabilities for methods that support static registration.
-local static_registration_capabilities = {
-  ['textDocument/prepareCallHierarchy'] = 'callHierarchyProvider',
-  ['textDocument/documentColor'] = 'colorProvider',
-  ['textDocument/declaration'] = 'declarationProvider',
-  ['textDocument/diagnostic'] = 'diagnosticProvider',
-  ['textDocument/foldingRange'] = 'foldingRangeProvider',
-  ['textDocument/implementation'] = 'implementationProvider',
-  ['textDocument/inlayHint'] = 'inlayHintProvider',
-  ['textDocument/inlineCompletion'] = 'inlineCompletionProvider',
-  ['textDocument/inlineValue'] = 'inlineValueProvider',
-  ['textDocument/linkedEditingRange'] = 'linkedEditingRangeProvider',
-  ['textDocument/moniker'] = 'monikerProvider',
-  ['textDocument/selectionRange'] = 'selectionRangeProvider',
-  ['textDocument/semanticTokens/full'] = 'semanticTokensProvider',
-  ['textDocument/semanticTokens/range'] = 'semanticTokensProvider',
-  ['textDocument/typeDefinition'] = 'typeDefinitionProvider',
-  ['textDocument/prepareTypeHierarchy'] = 'typeHierarchyProvider',
-}
-
 --- @private
 function Client:_process_static_registrations()
   local static_registrations = {} ---@type lsp.Registration[]
 
-  for method, capability in pairs(static_registration_capabilities) do
+  for method, capability in pairs(vim.lsp.protocol._request_name_to_server_capability) do

@@ -1189,6 +1170,19 @@ function Client:supports_method(method, bufnr)
   return false
 end
 
+--- Checks if a client can facilitate a `Provider` for a specific RegistrationMethod
+---@param method vim.lsp.protocol.RegistrationMethods
+function Client:supports_registrationMethod(method)
+  local required_capability = lsp.protocol._request_name_to_server_capability[method]
+  if not required_capability then
+    return false
+  end
+  if vim.tbl_get(self.server_capabilities, unpack(required_capability)) then
+    return true
+  end
+  return false

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
---@alias vim.lsp.protocol.RegistrationMethod
```
The type should be singular as it references variables representing a single method.
While we iterate and improve this capability design I would prefer we keep this method private/undocumented for now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1189,6 +1170,19 @@ function Client:supports_method(method, bufnr)
   return false
 end
 
+--- Checks if a client can facilitate a `Provider` for a specific RegistrationMethod
+---@param method vim.lsp.protocol.RegistrationMethods
+function Client:supports_registrationMethod(method)

 ---@field client_state table<integer, STClientState>

   name = 'semantic_tokens',

comment_data.body: I know that this is generated code, but could we keep the alphabetical order?

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -200,6 +200,26 @@ local function write_to_vim_protocol(protocol)
     output[#output + 1] = '}'
   end
 
+  do --- registrationMethods

comment_data.body:
We can, but it would be more abstract as we would have to create the list and then sort it afterwards, rather than writing it into the output directly.

Would it be better if there were a comment directly above it explaining why it was in a separate "section"?
I have moved it to `vim.lsp.protocol.Method.Registration`, as it feels more like a subset of Methods
This doesnt feel right, is there a way to make the docs collapse this to just `string`

comment_regular_data.body: can you describe `capability_is_registered` and `supports_method` , how would each be presented in docs?

`Supports method`:

```
--- Checks if a client supports a given method.
--- Always returns true for unknown off-spec methods.
---
--- Note: Some language server capabilities can be file specific.
```

I think maybe a better name is

`supports_registrationMethod`:
```
--- Checks if a client can facilitate a `Provider` for a specific RegistrationMethod
```
Using the same `supports_*` prefix definitely helps intuition (assuming the name makes sense).

title: refactor(lsp): unify capability checks and registration
